choices.name: Get started with research for your Arizona ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Arizona ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Arizona research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Arizona research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Arizona Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for Arizona ancestors, from 1850 to 1910.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Arizona Research, 1850-1910-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for Arizona research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Arizona Resources
    ☆ AC—Arizona State Research Guide

  4. Record Finder: Use the Arizona Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Arizona Record Finder

    5. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about colonial records in Arizona.

      ☆ AC—Colonial Records of Arizona

    Ethnic
    1. Learn about African Americans in Arizona in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Arizona

    2. Learn about American Indians in Arizona in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Arizona


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Learn about colonial records in Arizona.

    ☆ AC—Colonial Records of Arizona
Ethnic
  1. Learn about African Americans in Arizona in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Arizona

  2. Learn about American Indians in Arizona in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Arizona

1. Explore Arizona historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Arizona History

  2. Explore Arizona history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Arizona

  3. Learn about Arizona history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Arizona History

  4. Explore an extensive collection of Arizona history documents on the Arizona Genealogy site.

    ☆ History of Arizona

choices.name: Learn about Arizona archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Arizona archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Arizona Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Arizona State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore records from the Arizona State Archives collection.
  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Arizona.
  4. Explore the Arizona Memory Project site
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Arizona genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Arizona ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Arizona city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Arizona Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Arizona city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Arizona city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Arizona ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Access facts and information for Arizona counties.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Arizona County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Arizona.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Arizona Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Arizona Genealogy page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  3. Visit Arizona Genealogy - Just Ask!
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Arizona.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Arizona research.
  2. Explore the Arizona research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Arizona research.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Arizona in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Arizona Societies

  2. Explore the Arizona State Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Arizona Historical Society site.
  4. Explore Arizona genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Arizona.
